body_html:
@liusiqi43 Actually scalar_summary is just an op that returns a string; it doesn't have any side effects. The problem is that you can't use tf.merge_all_summaries to link together outputs from across the while loop. If you want this to work, you'd have to manually merge the summaries during the while loop using tf.merge_summaries.

However, hanging seems like unfortunate behavior. @yuanbyu Is there anything we can do on our end to throw an error rather than hanging in this case?
body_text:
@liusiqi43 Actually scalar_summary is just an op that returns a string; it doesn't have any side effects.  The problem is that you can't use tf.merge_all_summaries to link together outputs from across the while loop.  If you want this to work, you'd have to manually merge the summaries during the while loop using tf.merge_summaries.
However, hanging seems like unfortunate behavior.  @yuanbyu Is there anything we can do on our end to throw an error rather than hanging in this case?
body:
@liusiqi43 Actually `scalar_summary` is just an op that returns a string; it doesn't have any side effects.  The problem is that you can't use `tf.merge_all_summaries` to link together outputs from across the while loop.  If you want this to work, you'd have to manually merge the summaries during the while loop using `tf.merge_summaries`.

However, hanging seems like unfortunate behavior.  @yuanbyu Is there anything we can do on our end to throw an error rather than hanging in this case?
